events.name: Learn about Google Cloud Platform at the first GCP User Group North West Meetup

venue.name: Cloud Technology Solutions
venue.address_1: 10th Floor, Lowry House, 17 Marble Street, Manchester, M2 3AW

group.name: Google Cloud Platform Users North West

events.description:
I’m delighted to announce the first Google Cloud Platform meetup in Manchester on January 24th at 6pm, to be held at the new Cloud Technology Solutions office in central Manchester.

The meet up is suitable for anyone looking to understand more about Google’s public cloud platform or for those who work in a Cloud focussed role and just want to find out a little bit more on what GCP is all about.

Joining us on the day will be a Google Engineer who will be offering first hand insights into the latest developments on the platform. We will also be joined by an existing GCP customer who will be talking about the technical benefits they have gained from moving to the platform, and you will also have the opportunity to network over a few beers and a slice of pizza (or two) after!

Agenda
Instant insights:
To give one a sense of how the pieces of our Data and Analytics Platform come together, we’re going to look at an agency that places ads on those connected displays in the back of NYC taxis. They are sending real-time data - taxi position, destination, passenger count, whether the passenger clicked on the ad for more info, etc - at the rate of X thousand data points per second.

Kubernetes Whack a Pod (mole):
It is an interactive demo that combines a Whack a mole machine with GKE/kubernetes.

We hope you can join us,

Chris

events.name: Join us at GCP User Group North West #2

group.name: Google Cloud Platform Users North West

events.description:
Hi everyone,

Our next GCP user group will be taking place on Thursday, May 3rd. The good folks at Autotrader have kindly offered to host us at their offices in central Manchester, so we won't be pushed for space.

The confirmed agenda is as follows:

GCP in Action - How Autotrader are using GCP to run Elasticstack, Mike Eves, Autotrader

Migrating from Heroku to GCP and enabling development team agility - Jake Clarkson, Amigo Technology

GCP Machine Learning APIs - Stefan Hogendoorn, Data Scientist, Qlouder

The meet up is suitable for anyone looking to understand more about Google’s public cloud platform or for those who work in a Cloud focussed role and just want to find out a little bit more on what GCP is all about.

We look forward to seeing you soon.

Xander Munro

events.name: GCP User Group North West #3 - Next Special

group.name: Google Cloud Platform Users North West

events.description:
Hi everyone,

The next GCP Meet Up is confirmed to take place on Thursday, August 2nd 6:30pm at Plant NOMA. Taking place a week after Google Cloud Next in San Francisco, we will be looking at covering some of the news, releases and updates that come out of the three day exhibition.

Confirmed to speak at the event are:

Ian Pattison - Customer Engineer at Google. Ian will be looking at what some of the new releases mean for customers, with a particular focus on the retail sector. Expect demos and use cases.

Adam Wood - GCP engineer at CTS. Adam will be taking a look at some of the technical releases revealed at Google Next and touching on what excites him the most with a possible live demo to boot.

Shaun Hall - Head of R&D and DevOps at The Hut Group. With an ecommerce platform that gets 15 million hits per day, Shaun will be looking at how they use GCP to power recommendations, personalisation and A/B test analysis on their sites.

The Hut Group will kindly be providing refreshments, so you'll have the chance to network over a few beers and a slice of pizza (or two) after!

If you are lucky enough to be going to Next and would like to share your experience with the group please get in touch.

Thanks,

Xander

events.name: GCP User Group North West #4

group.name: Google Cloud Platform Users North West

events.description:
The next GCP Meet Up is confirmed to take place on Thursday 8 November 6:30pm, at The Hut Group's new Auditorium, Floor 10, Orange Tower, Media City.

Agenda
Matt Day - Customer Engineer at Google Cloud
- How I trained the cloud to recognise crisps

Tim Ellis-Smith - Platform Engineer at Cloud Technology Solutions
- Automatically importing data into BigQuery using dataflow, dataprep and functions

Tim Waterson, Senior Software Engineer at The Hut Group
- Globalising our e-commerce platform with GCP

If you would have any questions for the speakers or you would like to speak at this meet up or any future, please get in touch.

Refreshments will be provided so you'll have the chance to network over a few beers and a slice of pizza (or two) after!

events.name: GCP User Group North West #5 - Homeserve, KPMG and Google

group.name: Google Cloud Platform Users North West

events.description:
The next GCP Meet Up is due to take place on Wednesday 6 February 6:30pm, at the KPMG Manchester offices with confirmed speakers from Google, KMPG and Homeserve Leakbot.

Agenda
Krystian Pasich - Senior Backend Developer at Homeserve Leakbot
- Leakbot and The Move to GCP

Gary Bowers - Lead Cloud Engineer at KPMG
- Securing Google Cloud with Forseti

Justin Grayston - Customer Engineer at Google Cloud
- Knative - The Why, The What and The When

If you would have any questions for the speakers or you would like to speak at this meet up or any future, please get in touch.

Refreshments will be provided so you'll have the chance to network over a few beers after!
events.how_to_find_us: Speak to the KPMG reception desk on arrival where you will be given a badge and directed to floor 11.
